tweets.text:
8/ üìö Resources: Learn more about advanced functional programming in R with these books and articles:
‚Ä¢"Functional Programming in R" by Thomas Mailund
‚Ä¢"R for Data Science" by Hadley Wickham and Garrett Grolemund
‚Ä¢"purrr tutorial" by Jenny Bryan
#rstats #datascience

7/ ü§ù Integration: Combine functional programming with other R tools like:
‚Ä¢dplyr for data manipulation in a functional style
‚Ä¢ggplot2 for creating complex, custom plots
‚Ä¢tidyr for reshaping data with functional principles
#rstats #datascience #AdvancedR

6/ üöÄ Performance: Speed up your functional code by:
‚Ä¢Using purrr's typed map() functions for efficient iteration
‚Ä¢Employing base R's *apply() family when possible
‚Ä¢Leveraging data.table for large-scale data manipulation
#rstats #datascience #AdvancedR

5/ üí° Advanced Iteration: Iterate over complex data structures with:
‚Ä¢map_at() and modify_at() for specific elements
‚Ä¢map_depth() for nested lists
‚Ä¢imap() to iterate with index
#rstats #datascience #AdvancedR

4/ üéØ Functional Composition: Combine multiple functions into a single operation using:
‚Ä¢purrr::compose() to create a composite function
‚Ä¢magrittr::%>% (pipe) for chaining operations
‚Ä¢purrr::partial() to pre-specify function arguments
#rstats #datascience #AdvancedR

3/ üîÑ Loop Alternatives: Replace traditional loops with functional equivalents:
‚Ä¢map() instead of for loops
‚Ä¢map_dbl(), map_chr(), map_lgl(), and map_int() for type-specific output
‚Ä¢map2() and pmap() for iterating over multiple objects
#rstats #datascience #AdvancedR

2/ üêæ purrr Basics: Transform your code using purrr's functional tools:
‚Ä¢map() functions for element-wise operations
‚Ä¢reduce() for cumulative operations
‚Ä¢pmap() for multiple input iteration
‚Ä¢safely() to handle errors gracefully
#rstats #datascience #AdvancedR

1/ üéõÔ∏è Advanced Functional Programming in R: purrr and beyond üöÄ Discover the power of functional programming techniques in R to write cleaner, more efficient code. #rstats #AdvancedR #FunctionalProgramming #DataScience https://t.co/bgWfo6eCPb
The rivers of Indian Subcontinent. Inspired from @milos_agathon #rstats #rspatial #gis #maps #india #rivers https://t.co/9BBtabFhgr

I‚Äôm trying hard to learn #RStats using @LisaDeBruine et als e-learning. Doing a little every day. But I‚Äôm still MILES away from being able to do something meaningful with a dataset without really explicit scaffolding‚Ä¶. https://t.co/0lBNZnMlCK

9/ üìö Resources: Learn more about advanced R package development with these books and articles:

"R Packages" by Hadley Wickham
"Advanced R" by Hadley Wickham
"Efficient R programming" by Matt Dowle
#rstats #datascience #AdvancedR

8/ üöÄ Deployment: Share your package with the world by:

‚ö´Ô∏èSubmitting to CRAN for wide distribution
‚ö´Ô∏èUsing devtools::release() for CRAN submission
‚ö´Ô∏èHosting on GitHub for easy installation with remotes or devtools
#rstats #datascience #AdvancedR

7/ üîÑ Dependency Management: Manage your package's dependencies by:

‚ö´Ô∏èListing them in the DESCRIPTION file
‚ö´Ô∏èUsing renv for project-specific library management
‚ö´Ô∏èKeeping dependencies minimal to improve portability
#rstats #datascience #AdvancedR

6/ üõ°Ô∏è Version Control: Keep track of your package's development with:

‚ö´Ô∏èGit for version control
‚ö´Ô∏èGitHub, GitLab, or Bitbucket for remote repositories
‚ö´Ô∏èFollowing a clear branching and merging strategy
#rstats #datascience #AdvancedR

5/ üìä Continuous Integration: Automate your testing process with:

‚ö´Ô∏èGitHub Actions for R package checks and tests
‚ö´Ô∏èUsing usethis::use_github_action_check_standard() to set up the workflow
‚ö´Ô∏èMonitoring build status with badges in README
#rstats #datascience #AdvancedR

4/ üß™ Testing: Ensure the reliability of your package by:

‚ö´Ô∏èWriting unit tests with testthat
‚ö´Ô∏èUsing usethis::use_test() to set up tests
‚ö´Ô∏èAdding test data in tests/testthat/ directory
‚ö´Ô∏èRunning tests with devtools::test()
#rstats #datascience #AdvancedR

3/ üìù Documentation: Make your package user-friendly by:

‚ö´Ô∏èWriting clear, concise function descriptions
‚ö´Ô∏èUsing roxygen2 for function documentation
‚ö´Ô∏èCreating package-level documentation with pkgdown
‚ö´Ô∏èWriting vignettes to demonstrate usage
#rstats #datascience #AdvancedR

2/ üèóÔ∏è Package Structure: Organize your package effectively by:

‚ö´Ô∏èUsing usethis::create_package() to set up the structure
‚ö´Ô∏èOrganizing functions in R/ directory
‚ö´Ô∏èPlacing data in data/ or extdata/ directories
‚ö´Ô∏èAdding vignettes and README for documentation 
#rstats #datascience

1/ üìö Advanced R Package Development: Best Practices and Tips üõ†Ô∏è Explore the process of creating, documenting, and testing your own R packages like a pro! #rstats #AdvancedR #PackageDevelopment #DataScience https://t.co/ChxFDRGy21
Pretty sure a 6 year old is better at doing this https://t.co/tigz9HAC1x

9/ üìö Resources: Learn more about advanced Shiny app development with these books and articles:
‚Ä¢"Mastering Shiny" by Hadley Wickham
‚Ä¢"Web Application Development with R Using Shiny" by Chris Beeley
‚Ä¢"Engineering Production-Grade Shiny Apps" by Colin Fay et al. #rstats

8/ üîí Security: Protect your app and users by:
‚Ä¢Implementing authentication and user management
‚Ä¢Sanitizing user input to prevent code injection
‚Ä¢Utilizing HTTPS and secure connections #rstats #datascience

7/ üåê Deployment: Share your Shiny app with the world using:
‚Ä¢Shiny Server or Shiny Server Pro for self-hosting
‚Ä¢RStudio Connect for secure, scalable deployments
‚Ä¢https://t.co/XvnGBkvcjd for easy, cloud-based hosting #rstats #datascience

6/ üé® Custom Themes: Personalize your Shiny app's appearance by:
‚Ä¢Using shinythemes or bslib for predefined themes
‚Ä¢Customizing Bootstrap themes with Sass
‚Ä¢Creating your own CSS stylesheets for complete control #rstats #datascience

5/ üß™ Testing and Debugging: Ensure your app is bug-free and reliable with:
‚Ä¢Debugging tools like browser(), debug(), and shiny::reactlog()
‚Ä¢Shinytest for automated testing of app functionality
‚Ä¢shinyloadtest for load testing and scalability #rstats #datascience

4/ üìä Integration: Combine your Shiny app with other tools and packages for more versatility:
‚Ä¢Embedding Shiny apps in R Markdown documents
‚Ä¢Utilizing ggplot2, plotly, or highcharter for interactive visualizations
‚Ä¢Connecting with databases for real-time data updates

1/ üß™ Advanced Shiny App Development: Tips for Creating Engaging, Scalable, and Robust Apps üåê Dive into this thread to learn how to build powerful, interactive web apps with Shiny! We'll cover advanced features, optimization, and deployment. #rstats #datascience #ShinyApps https://t.co/1Dds8Ry4UV

urls.title: Kronos: A computational tool to facilitate biological rhythmicity analysis
urls.description: Motivation: Circadian rhythms, or 24-hour biological cycles, are key in maintaining health in almost all living organisms and synchronize important physiological and behavioural processes daily. Interest in circadian rhythm research is expanding as our urban environments have increased exposure to factors that can disrupt the normal physiological rhythm of our body, such as delayed bedtimes, shift work, jet-lag, increased screen-time, and exposure to artificial light. Discovering how oscillatory signals respond to both external and internal factors can lead to important biological breakthroughs, but assessing rhythmicity can be both limited by the complexity of statistical models and demanding in terms of coding and statistical expertise. Implementation: Here, we describe the development of a novel easy-to-use R-based tool, Kronos, to assess circadian rhythms in biological data sets. Kronos provides the user with new functionalities not currently available, including the analysis of tw

tweets.text: Kronos: A computational tool to facilitate biological rhythmicity analysis  https://t.co/VcCLOevaV3 #bioRxiv

tweets.text: Trying to convert survey age responses ("18-24 years old") to integers in #Rstudio for graphing histograms & scatterplots. Advice from SO ( https://t.co/udAJTLj2Vi ) isn't working. The best I could get is a manual sum of each age group. How to proceed from here? New to #Rstats https://t.co/TCM3Q1Kfb9

It's common for legacy code to have deeply nested statements

They make code harder to read/think about (cognitive overload) üòµ‚Äçüí´

Did you know "Guard Clauses" can help you simplify these? Now you know üíÇ

Here's a JavaScript example üëá https://t.co/7L0etmMz4A
